methods.Synopsis: Returns information on Sentinel users the current user can manage

parameters.Name: accept_fmt
parameters.Description: text/csv - provides a list with the following items - username, role, sites (I think), and what I'm guessing is company (WhiteHat). application/json - returns user and sub-user info (only seeing user info, guessing there are no sub-users setup.), including user capabilities. text/xmll - same as application/json, except without user capabilities.

methods.Synopsis: Returns information on sites user has access to

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: Selects the requested response representation format.

parameters.Name: client_id
parameters.Description: Restricts sites to those in client_id to which the user has access.

parameters.Name: display_entry_points
parameters.Description: Entry points are starting point URLs for scan crawling. Setting this option will include a list of entry points as a property of the Site resource.

parameters.Name: display_assessment_complete
parameters.Description: Expose 'assessment_complete' as a boolean property of the Site resource which indicates whether there are outstanding vulnerabilities under assessment. A false value indicates that either scanning or evaluation is incomplete.

parameters.Name: display_vuln_policy
parameters.Description: Expose 'vuln_policy' as an object property of the Site resource which refers to the Vulnerability Policy currently applied to the site.

parameters.Name: display_allowed_hosts
parameters.Description: Expose a list of allowed hosts as a property of the Site resource. Allowed hosts are hosts other than the site_url which are allowed be scanned as a part of a Site.

parameters.Name: display_scan_status
parameters.Description: Expose a list of scan related indicators as a property on the Site resource. These flags indicate whether scans are running properly and whether user action is required to make scans run.

parameters.Name: display_site_credentials
parameters.Description: Expose a list of site credentials which may be used to log into the site under test. These are represented in plain text in order to allow for automated processes. It is recommended that sensitive credentials not be used for this purpose.

parameters.Name: display_vuln_stats
parameters.Description: Expose simple statistics about the number of vulns on the Site.

parameters.Name: display_scan_schedule
parameters.Description: Expose the scan schedule which indicates when automated scanning will take place.

parameters.Name: display_groups
parameters.Description: Expose a list of groups to which the site belongs as a property of the Site resource

parameters.Name: display_all
parameters.Description: A meta-parameter which exposes all of the properties which may be exposed by display parameters.

parameters.Name: display_min
parameters.Description: A meta-parameter which exposes only the label and id properties of the Site resource. This parameter is lowest precedence and so other display parameters may be used to expose specific properties.
